ygData.messageBody:
I learned this the hard was.

I tested invis in the gorge. OK the minor still saw me. Lesson one
learned

Grouped with a neco in Najena. Fell in the trap and our group survived
the baddies.

Only to have the injured halfling attack the necros pet. the necro
Feigned and I started invis. We are fine, right? nope the invis
lapsed on the necro and the halfling attacks him. he feigns again.
now the halfling is attacking me...

Had to bolt for the exit as I don't want bad halfling faction.
Everyone was following but, in the mess one of the other party members
gets stunned and left to die to the nasties of najena. We were
basically lost and looking for a way out.


those terrors kill quickly when you are alone.

--- John Kim <kim@...> wrote:
> From: John Kim <kim@...>
>
> On Mon, 21 Jun 1999, CMai wrote:
> >
> > Question about the invis song: Is it possible to
> hit something then run far
> > away but not zone and hit Invis, will the mob that
> u were hitting find u?
>
> Nope. A mob that's aggressive to you will see you
> through
> invisibility (although if you run far enough away
> from many
> mobs, they will give up chasing you although their
> aggressive
> radius to you remains enlarged). In fact, if you
> are playing
> the invisibility song and any member of your party
> is
> attacked, you will immediately be attacked because
> (1) you're
> a bard, and (2) you cast a beneficial "spell" on
> someone who
> was just attacked so the mob is now aggressive to
> you too.
>
> Because of (1) it's actually not uncommon for one of
> my party
> to briefly become visible, the mob(s) charge him,
> and the next
> pulse they all retarget me because I'm a bard. What
> can I
> say, get good armor. :-)
>
> You really have to watch out for (2) if you're in a
> group with
> mixed factions. If your paladin friend has to kill
> the
> corrupt guard at the Freeport bank and your song
> pulses on him
> while he fights, you will lose faction along with
> him. If
> your troll buddy gets whacked by the guards and one
> of your
> songs pulses before he dies, the guards will be
> after you
> next.
>
> --
> John H. Kim
